operations

Class InputOutput

  • java.lang.Object
    • operations.InputOutput

  • public class InputOutput
extends java.lang.Object
    The Input/Output class handles all of the inputs from the user that are used continuously. These include Yes/no inputs, a title deed operation menu , information about the square a player object is on, an integer menu to make choices numerically, handling user options when they land on a square and a menu for a player to select another player to interact with.
    Author:
    Robert Keenan and Ciaran Nolan

    • Method Detail

      • printSeparator

        public static void printSeparator()

      • yesNoInput

        public static boolean yesNoInput(java.lang.String message,
                                 Player player,
                                 java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        This method handles any times that a yes or no input is used which is taken in the form of a single character "y" or "n". It reads in the user input and returns the the acknowledgement or no acknowledgement
        Parameters:
        message - The message which is to be presented to the user
        player - The Player object which is making the input
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit
        Returns:
        y if y entered, n if not

      • titleDeedOperationMenu

        public static TitleDeed titleDeedOperationMenu(Player player,
                                               java.lang.String operation,
                                               boolean housesHotels,
                                               java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        This is used for Player objects to select a TitleDeed card to conduct an operation such as mortgaging that CanOwn object associated with the TitleDeed card or perhaps build on the site. It loops through the player object's title deed cards to check if they can mortgage or improve the given object It then can decide what the type of operation is such as houses or hotels
        Parameters:
        player - The player object which is acting on this method
        operation - The operation the player object wishes to do
        housesHotels - Boolean to determine if it is related to houses or hotels
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit
        Returns:
        TitleDeed object if title deed selected, house hotel list of a title deed, null otherwise

      • squareInformation

        public static void squareInformation(int index)
        This method is used to print a number of details about the current square that a Player object is on on the board and may influence their decision in what they do next
        Parameters:
        index - The index on the board of the square

      • createListPlayers

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Player> createListPlayers(java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        This creates the list of players who will take part in a game. It prompts the users to input players in a specific form with Name,token. The token has to be a colour which are printed on the screen. It then creates Player objects for each of the players entered with minimum 2 players to maximum 6.
        Parameters:
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit
        Returns:
        listPlayers, an ArrayList of type Player with the Players for the game

      • integerMenu

        public static int integerMenu(int lowerBound,
                              int upperBound,
                              java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        This integer menu is used for when you are given a choice and the you can provide upper and lower bounds when choosing the input. It presents the user on the command with a statement of a range of digits and you enter the relevant number.
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - The lower bound of the integer menu as an integer
        upperBound - The lower bound of the integer menu as an integer
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit
        Returns:
        choiceInput which is an integer choice, -1 if no choice

      • handleUserOption

        public static void handleUserOption(Player currentPlayer,
                                    boolean doubleRoll,
                                    java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        This class handles the user option from the integer menu. When an Integer menu number is entered by the user, it is interpreted by this method and actions are carried out as a result such as mortgaging, building, buying/selling or just printing a player's status. These choices are handled by a switch statement.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - The current player object which entered the options
        doubleRoll - Whether a double has been rolled
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit

      • selectPlayerMenu

        static Player selectPlayerMenu(Player selectingPlayer,
                               java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        This is a method that handles the interaction between 2 players. The player who wants to interact must specify the player object as an argument and then we can search through the global playerList to find the player they wish to interact with.
        Parameters:
        selectingPlayer - The Player who is selecting a player to interact with
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit
        Returns:
        playerMenu.get(choiceInput), The player object you wish to interact with
